topic.title: Can ZeroNet help to access internet during blackout internet?
topic.body:
I mean when we faced with restricted internet (for example its turn to intranet) can ZeroNet somehow help us to access the internet?
Imagine the internet is restricted and I want to use "Mathway" Android app, how can I connect "Mathway" to his server?
Play Store link: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.bagatrix.mathway.android&hl=en

1575912544_1T4nUY5eDwwMk3zFjh27ZQCqkVpPx.body:
> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_1271_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): Are you dead dumbor all arabs are?

dude persians not arabs ! there aren't same thing !

1575994787_1Q5f5jQxn2duHpJCCdWhYCkeM8pGa.body:
> [sprite1ww](#comment_9_1Q5f5jQxn2duHpJCCdWhYCkeM8pGagUDdp): Damn, that sucks, more power to you guys! Also I didn't make this thread to mean anything negative, I just thought it would help both parties find the content for their languages easier [...]

i think apps like firechat didn't work cuz IoT in iran dosn't develop so much...

1575818739_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYN.body:
> [muhwaycism](#comment_32_1C6QSjAqcgSv7Mom3e2C9dtLSKXkJrDiJU): But we can haz turrism breads tho...

you already have it..

1576021462_1K8NrwqEfy49zAMWzHgywnToZib7P.body:
> [lianna](#comment_63_16ePf6TBgip2eF88AxhnRJdPXyZJK1V2S4): ZeroNet can't (easily) be used as an outproxy. It most certainly wouldn't work for your use case. [...]

thank you

1576026161_17ZnSRGrALWLigjaDhkzUM4KAC8c8.body:
> [falconixx](#comment_6_17ZnSRGrALWLigjaDhkzUM4KAC8c8rv8Eu): it is not theoretical, this is a problem that i am trying to help Persian people with.

Thank you for helping Persian people

> [selfsigned](#comment_3_1F599yb2J8DmRn8nAxyN7e9MRuaU6QZfkZ): Understood. I don't know anything about Persians, nor their network infraestructure, wifi saturation or the level of risk you're trying to get in. I don't know wich kind of connections are trully censored at all. [...]

I'm here what's your question?
it seems our internet will be restricted to website which hosted in Iran
and if its happend then china is not the worst...
any comment?

> [selfsigned](#comment_4_1F599yb2J8DmRn8nAxyN7e9MRuaU6QZfkZ): so, your question is more related on how to access from one country (uknown? ) to a host on other country (this case Iran). [...]

correction:
how to access from one country (this case Iran ) to a host on other country (unknown?).
+
privacy about IP revealing and stuff is matter because the consequences of using bypass tools exist.

> [selfsigned](#comment_4_1F599yb2J8DmRn8nAxyN7e9MRuaU6QZfkZ): so, your question is more related on how to access from one country (uknown? ) to a host on other country (this case Iran). [...]

I don't know if it helps or not but it seems just "shadowsocks" protocol work very well in that situation
===============================================================
 a few days ago blackout happened and nothing work include ( OpenVPN, wireguard etc.) but Iran proxies work very well BUT yesterday when it happens again even IR proxy doesn't work but "shadowsocks" protocol works well...

1576287725_1G9k2b4cSRzZSfLQuzxmpJB3LT3Gf.body:
